benchmark_details.name: I NDIC LINK
benchmark_details.overview: I NDIC LINK is a new evaluation dataset for the task of Multilingual Fact Linking, containing linked WikiData facts and sentences in English and six Indian languages.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To facilitate research in the task of Multilingual Fact Linking and to provide a dataset to evaluate models linking natural language sentences with knowledge graph facts.

data.source: Linked WikiData facts and sentences from the relation extraction dataset WebRED, translated into multiple Indian languages.
data.annotation: Manual translation by professional translators and automatic translation for training.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated by comparing predicted facts with gold set of facts.
methodology.interpretation: Higher Precision@1 indicates that the most confident predicted fact matches a gold fact.
methodology.baseline_results: R EFCOG outperforms re-ranking models with a 10.7 points improvement in Precision@1.
methodology.validation: 5% of training examples used as a validation set for early stopping.
